text:
<!everyone> hey folks and happy friday!
---
i'm thinking of putting together some guidelines for each channel. i know that it's not always clear where a post should live. e.g. a question about linkedin distribution could fit in
i'm thinking of creating specific guidelines for each channel. atm, it's not clear what belongs in each. e.g. if you want quotes for a post, do you use <#CUYDAGXKR|b2b-content-chat> or <#C014P2BJLER|ask-me-anything> or <#CKRJX5U5A|collab>? if you want to talk distribution for a client's content, do you use <#CJ7QQKJ73|-content-strategy-questions> or <#C0226F0HVV1|agency-life>? anyone have suggestions on things that should (or should not) be in certain channels? i'm also open to adding/removing channels. hit me with your ideas!
---
here are a few great threads from the past few days:
• <@U021S4J44TV> →  <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CJ7QQKJ73/p1646699751883279|I am looking to find an agency or a source that can help build out those super comprehensive data-backed content pieces (i.e., the State of Email Compliance in 2022). Is there one you would recommend that could do something like that>?
• <@U017WRJTKF1> → <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CUYDAGXKR/p1646823638538439|if you were given the freedom to pick any metric to measure your content by, no matter how weird or outlandish it sounds, which one would you pick>?
• <@U028XDRBC3U> → <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/C022W2V1Q0Y/p1646771478439879|Just deep diving into a page that is currently ranking #7 with 177 backlinks going to it. Everything ranking between 1-6 for this search have between 1200 and 6000 backlinks. Realistically I'm not getting 1000 links for this one page. Any other suggestions to try to bump it into the top 5>?
• <@U0366EA9X5Z> → <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/C01PKP5C8R1/p1646958530992279|Celebrated my pup’s 11th birthday on Tuesday>! (we need more <#C01PKP5C8R1|pets> content! :dog::cat::parrot::chicken::snake::bug:)
---
okay, jobs!
:tv: = includes a video Q&A
:zap:️ = new this week

text:
Strongly support the idea of putting the "asking for a quote on X topic" ONLY in one channel! it doesn't interest me but I see it allllll the time so would be nice to be able to just not join that particular channel.

In general, I do agree — having clearer guidelines can help get better answers. in my mind right now the "b2b content chat" is more general and the "content strategy questions" is more specific around strategy development, but I don't know if that's how it's really being used

elements.text:
Strongly support the idea of putting the "asking for a quote on X topic" ONLY in one channel! it doesn't interest me but I see it allllll the time so would be nice to be able to just not join that particular channel.

In general, I do agree — having clearer guidelines can help get better answers. in my mind right now the "b2b content chat" is more general and the "content strategy questions" is more specific around strategy development, but I don't know if that's how it's really being used
